name: ECON 186
title: Mathematical Methods for Economic Analysis
description: Presents mathematical methods commonly used in graduate-level economic analysis: basic matrix algebra, real analysis, functions, continuity concepts, differentiation, Taylor expansions, and implicit function theorem and optimization.

pre_req_data.text: Enrollment is restricted to applied economics and finance graduate students.

class_notes: Course is taught in an accelerated manner for incoming M.S. APEF students (from 9/5-9/22/2023). Please contact the economics graduate programs coordinator (econ_grad_coor@ucsc.edu) for course scheduling details.
